name: biaxial
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having two axes (= real or imaginary straight lines going through the centre of a object that is spinning, or lines that divide a shape into two equal halves) : The polymer has biaxial orientation, stretched along both its latitudinal and longitudinal axes. The glass has high tensile strength and can remain unaffected by biaxial strain.
relating to an axis that goes from left to right through the middle of a picture, design, etc., and another than goes from the top to the bottom: The flag has biaxial symmetry, so it looks the same when you turn it upside-down. The parking garage had a biaxial layout, with an elevator near each of the four corners.
